questions.question:
Answer the questions given below (refer Fig.2):


Fig. 2. Circuit diagram of single-phase bridge inverter.


1. In a single-phase bridge inverter, when the output is ‘-Vin’

explanations.a: Explanation 1: In a single-phase inverter, the output voltage is “-V<sub>in</sub>” when switch “S<sub>3</sub>” and “S<sub>4</sub>” are conducting.

questions.question: 2. In single-phase inverter, gate pulse is available for switches “S<sub>1</sub>” and “S<sub>2</sub>” when

answers.a: Carrier is greater than reference signal
answers.b: Reference is greater than carrier signal

explanations.b: Explanation 2: The PWM signals/scheme for the single-phase inverter is generated by comparing the reference with carrier signal and hence reference signal should be higher than carrier signal.

questions.question: 3. A multi-pulse PWM scheme is used to drive the switches of a single-phase bridge inverter. If ‘V<sub>dc</sub>’ is the inverter input voltage, the rms value of load voltage is given by

explanations.a: Explanation 1: In a single-phase bridge inverter using multi-pulse PWM, the RMS value of the output voltage is proportional to the modulation index MI, which controls the ratio of the reference signal amplitude to the carrier signal amplitude. The modulation index, MI determines the effective duty cycle and thus affects the RMS value of the load voltage.

questions.question: 4. A single-phase bridge inverter driven with sinusoidal PWM. The reference waveform frequency (f<sub>r</sub>) is  50 Hz while the carrier frequency (f<sub>c</sub>) is 5 kHz. The number of pulses per half cycle of the output voltage waveform will be

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Number of Pulses per Half Cycle=f<sub>c</sub>/2f<sub>r</sub>
